meanings.definition: Done, performed, delivered, etc., at once or without delay.
meanings.sent1: She gave the promptest reply to the question in class.
meanings.sent2: He is known for his promptest arrival at every meeting.
meanings.sent3: The promptest squirrel in the park always finds the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the promptest sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The promptest delivery of the package impressed the customer.

meanings.sent1: The promptest student in the class finished the test first.
meanings.sent2: Being promptest in emergencies is crucial for a firefighter.
meanings.sent3: The promptest cat in the house always catches the mouse first.
meanings.sent4: His mind was the promptest weapon in debates.
meanings.sent5: The promptest decision saved them from missing the train.

meanings.definition: To move or induce to action.
meanings.sent1: She tried to promptest her friend to join the dance.
meanings.sent2: The coach promptests the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician promptested the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: His speech promptested the audience to stand up and applaud.
meanings.sent5: The music promptested everyone to start dancing.
